title: Apollo 11
desc: The first mission to land humans on the Moon, Apollo 11 successfully landed astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin on July 20, 1969.

title: Chandrayaan-1
desc: India's first lunar probe, Chandrayaan-1, was launched by ISRO in 2008. It provided significant data that led to the discovery of water on the Moon.

title: Curiosity Rover
desc: Launched in 2011, NASA's Curiosity Rover explored the surface of Mars to investigate its climate and geology and search for signs of life.

title: Chang'e 4
desc: The first mission to successfully land on the far side of the Moon, Chang'e 4 was launched by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) in 2018.

title: Juno
desc: NASA's Juno mission, launched in 2011, aims to study Jupiterâ€™s atmosphere, magnetic field, and structure to understand its formation and evolution.

title: Mars 2020 Perseverance Rover
desc: Perseverance Rover, launched in 2020, is exploring Mars to search for signs of ancient life and collect samples to return to Earth.

title: Artemis I
desc: NASA Artemis I mission is a key step in returning humans to the Moon and beyond. This uncrewed test flight, launched in 2022, was the first to send the Orion spacecraft on its way to lunar orbit.

title: Mars Orbiter Mission (Mangalyaan)
desc: Launched in 2013, Mangalyaan is India's first interplanetary mission, making ISRO the fourth space agency to reach Mars after NASA, the Soviet space program, and the European Space Agency.
